intro: Clerodendrum aculeatum var. gracile, commonly known as the slender glorybower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
